chunk: Omelette fingers recipe A tasty vegetable omelette. It’s quick for you to make, easy for baby to hold and eat, and great for adding some extra vegetables. Age: 6 months and older Prep: 5 mins Cook: 10 mins Portions: 8 (approx) Ingredients - 1 small onion, peeled and chopped - 1/2 medium pepper (any colour), chopped - 1 medium egg - 1 tbsp vegetable oil Method Crack the egg into a mixing bowl and beat. Heat the oil in a frying pan, add the onion and pepper, cook until soft (3 to 4 mins). Pour the egg into the frying pan, with the onion and pepper. Cook until the egg is set and the base is golden (2 to 3 mins). Allow to cool a little, then cut into finger-sized slices for easy feeding. Information: Enjoy leftovers as a light snack – share with older children in the family too.
title: Omelette Fingers
description: A tasty vegetable omelette. It’s quick for you to make, easy for baby to hold and eat, and great for adding some extra vegetables.
